hr.fer.zemris.java.tecaj.hw1

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.tecaj.hw1.Rectangle

  • public class Rectangle
extends java.lang.Object
    Program takes two arguments. First is width and second is height of a rectangle. Arguments can be given through command line or through standard system input. Both arguments need to be positive numbers. Program prints area and perimeter for given rectangle. If any error occurs, appropriate message is printed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Luka Skugor

      • readDimension

        public static double readDimension(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                   java.lang.String dimensionName)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads non-negative dimension from standard input and parses it as double. Prints error message if input is empty or if the value of dimension is negative.
        Parameters:
        reader - reads from standard input
        dimensionName - name of dimension which user needs to input
        Returns:
        double representation of read value
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - -

      • parseDimension

        public static double parseDimension(java.lang.String dimension,
                                    java.lang.String dimensionName)
        Parses non-negative dimension as value. Prints error message if input is empty or if the value of dimension is negative.
        Parameters:
        dimension - value as a String
        dimensionName - name of parsing dimension
        Returns:
        dimension parsed as double or -1 if error occurred
